hackathon-description-text: Hacking will take place in the Marston Science Library basement on the University of Florida's campus from 1/23 @ noon until 1/24 @ noon.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor at the University of Florida
Asst. Professor at the University of Florida
Asst. Director of UF Innovation Institute
CEO at Keep It Simple Technlolgies

hackathon-rules:
: The event opens for submissions at noon on 1/23. The event closes for submissions at noon on 1/24. No late or early submissions will be accepted.          
: Participation is limited to those who register at the physical event.
: Hackers can submit either complete or incomplete projects - as much as they are able to finish in 24 hours. Incomplete submissions will be judged using the same criteria as complete submissions.
: Hackers retain all rights and ownership of their respective projects. We may use project descriptions to promote the hackathon in future iterations.
: Judging will take place during a three-hour public demo fair/expo. The first half of the expo will see judges circulating among the expo, selecting a top 10 from the pool of teams. During the second half of the expo, those top 10 teams will be invited one-by-one to a private judging room where they will demo to a panel of VIP judges. From that pool, the judges will select a first, second, and third place prize.   Additional prizes include: best use of Clarifai API, voter's choice award (public voting at the expo), and organizer's choice award.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: {Dell Venue 10 5000 Android Tablet - Provided by MLH} And { The choice between:
We'll have a prize pool of XBOX Ones, Roku TVs, Kindle Fire tabs, Raspberry Pi CanaKits, Makey Makeys, and more! Each team member gets one prize, and second place gets second dibs.
We'll have a prize pool of XBOX Ones, Roku TVs, Kindle Fire tabs, Raspberry Pi CanaKits, Makey Makeys, and more! Each team member gets one prize, and third place gets third dibs.

The organizers LOVED your submission! Each member of the winning team will receive a View-Master VR Starter Pack. Additionally, the winning team as a whole will receive an exclusive gift from our organizing team.
Awarded for the best use of Clarifai's API in a hack. Each winner will receive a Clarifai branded skateboard and a DSLR camera.
Awarded for the best domain name hosting a hack. Each winner will receive a swag bag containing a Sparkfun Redboard and other hardware goodies.
Awarded for the best use of Amazon Web Services. Each winner will receive a 1TB hard drive.
Awarded for the best hack that performs some sort of measurement. The winning team will receive $200 in Amazon gift cards.
Awarded to the favorite hack of the State Farm representatives. Each member of the winning team will receive a Samsung Galaxy Tab.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=444 Newell Dr, Gainesville, FL 32603, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How awesome does the hack look?
How well does the hack work?
How easy and natural does using the hack feel?
How well did you convince the judges that your hack is the best?

hackathon-description-header: SwampHacks will see 400 hackers gather for a 24-hour software development marathon.
hackathon-location-description: University of Florida - Marston Science Library
